precontext: John had faced challenges in his career before. Each time, he approached them with determination. Now he stood before yet another one.
sentence: This will be his third try.
meanings_considered: put on trial or hear a case and sit as the judge at the trial of
explanation:
• "Try" as "make an effort" fits well with the precontext of John facing challenges and approaching them with determination—this aligns with repeated attempts in a career context.  
• "Try" as "put on trial" is implausible here, as there is no mention of legal proceedings, a court, or a case being heard, and the context is clearly about career challenges, not judicial proceedings.  
• The phrase "this will be his third try" naturally refers to repeated efforts or attempts in a personal or professional endeavor, which is consistent with meaning 1 and not a trial in a legal sense.
